intro: Croton pohlianus var. macrophyllus, commonly known as the giant croton, is a striking tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, giving it a dramatic appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
